intro: Caulanthus flavescens, commonly known as the yellow stalked crowfoot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, bluish-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Caulanthus flavescens typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as streambanks and meadows. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant gardening.
